name: Citizen Services Portal
description: Government citizen services portal for online applications, permits, and payments

inputs.projectVision: Unified online portal for citizens to access government services. Apply for permits and licenses, pay taxes and fees, schedule appointments, track application status, and access public records. Must integrate with 50+ legacy government systems and meet strict accessibility and security standards.

keyDeliverables: Vision for unified citizen portal
Business case with cost savings from digital services
Use case model from citizen focus groups
Risk assessment for legacy integration and compliance
Stakeholder analysis across government departments
Project charter with executive sponsorship
Layered architecture with integration layer
Enterprise service bus for legacy system integration
Accessibility-first design patterns (WCAG 2.1 AA)
Security architecture for FedRAMP compliance
Identity and access management design (SSO, MFA)
Prototype validating integration with key legacy systems
Detailed use cases with accessibility considerations
Iteration 1: User authentication and profile management
Iteration 2: Permit applications (building, business)
Iteration 3: Payment processing for taxes and fees
Iteration 4: Appointment scheduling and public records
Integration adapters for 50+ legacy systems
Responsive UI with full accessibility compliance
Multi-language support (English, Spanish, Vietnamese)
Comprehensive accessibility testing
Beta testing with 500 citizens
Phased rollout by service type (permits first, then payments)
Production deployment to government cloud (FedRAMP authorized)
Training for 200+ government staff across departments
Call center support for citizens
Public awareness campaign
Security audit and compliance certification

rationale: Government projects benefit from RUP's structured approach and emphasis on documentation. Complex legacy integration requires architecture validation in Elaboration. Accessibility and security compliance are addressed throughout. Two Transition iterations handle phased rollout and extensive training across multiple departments. Use-case driven approach ensures citizen needs are met.
